item.title: RUST error: linker `link.exe` not found
item.description:
Issue

While compiling Rust program in a windows environment, you may encounter the error : linker link.exe not found. This is because of the absence of the C++ build tools in your machine. For compiling Rust programs successfully, one of the prerequisites is the installation of the Build Tools for Visual Studio 2019.

Solution

Option 1

  • Download Visual Studio Build Tools

  • Install downloaded package

Option 2 (I tried this approach)

In my system, I've Visual Studio 2022, So instaled C++ related components by modifying Visual Studio settings.

  • Open Control Panel -> Programs and Features -> Search for 2022 -> Right click on Visual Studio 2022 -> Click on Change.

  • It would open Visual Settings page as shown below.

  • Click on Desktop development with C++ and install.

  • Once installation completed, You would you should be able to resolve cargo link.exe error and compile successfully :).
